Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can draw a clear and well-defined string telephone setup including two cups or cans connected by a tight string.
The student can illustrate and correctly label the string as a vital component for sound transmission.
The student can depict two students in the drawing interacting with the device, clearly showing how they use it to communicate over a distance.
The student can show additional details such as the placement of the cups correctly facing towards each student's mouth or ear, indicating an understanding of how sound travels.
The student can represent and label the materials accurately, emphasizing how the tightness of the string affects sound transmission.
The student can illustrate and annotate how this arrangement effectively solves communication over a distance using everyday items such as plastic cups and string.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally omit minor details, like forgetting to label one of the components (e.g., one of the students) but this is rare at Level 4.
There might be a slight inconsistency in how thoroughly every minor aspect is annotated or explained, though these are typically minor omissions and do not indicate a misunderstanding.
